chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J. Heil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:24 am
INCLUDES 15CF520, 15CF201, 15CM613, 14CF946, AND 14CM1964. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF520 AND 15CM613.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to: 
In 15CF520: Ct. 1 (Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM613: Ct. 1 (Misd. Theft/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 15CF520: Amended Ct. 1 (Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM613: Amended Ct. 1 (Misd. Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING AND SENTENCING ON REVOCATION IN ALL FILES. 
Def makes statement. VRCW. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF520: Ct. 1>>1 year MCJ with 91 days credit, DNA sample, and cc w/ 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
In 15CM613: Ct. 1>>6 months MCJ with NO days credit and cc w/ 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
In 15CF201: Ct. 1>>8 months MCJ with 125 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 8>>8 months MCJ with 125 days credit. 
In 14CF946: Ct. 2>>8 months MCJ with 125 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 4>>8 months MCJ with 125 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 5>>30 days MCJ with 30 days credit. 
In 14CM1964: Ct. 1>>90 days MCJ with 90 days credit. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run concurrent to each other. 
COURT approves jail with huber for school/treatment/work if def eligible under jail criteria on all sentences. 
COURT converts any unpaid court costs in revocation files converted to civil judgment including restitution - State to draft order for restitution. 

Adj: 9:46 am

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:19 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Julie Sawyer. Waiver of Prelim. filed. Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY 
PTC- 07/01/15 at 9:40 a.m. in Br.3 office. 
Bond is continued. 
Adj: 9:21 a.m. 
C: Br.3

of no contact w/W.P. signed 6/24/15
no special conditions

No contact with victim(s): W.P. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
